CONCLUSION: Remainder inadmissible;Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Enforcement proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time);Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property (Article 1 para. 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Peaceful enjoyment of possessions);Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed (Article 41 - Non-pecuniary damage;Just satisfaction);Non-pecuniary damage - award (Article 41 - Non-pecuniary damage;Just satisfaction)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE .
CARDINAL . The applicant is a businessman . In DATE he purchased a saw - mill with the intention of operating it as a going concern .
CARDINAL . In DATE the local authority ordered him to shut the saw - mill down because it was situated in the vicinity of sewage disposal installations and threatened the town 's sanitation .

CARDINAL . The applicant brought proceedings against the FAC municipal maintenance company ( муниципальное жилищно-коммунальное хозяйство города PERSON ) and the Maykop municipal water supply company ( муниципальное унитарное предприятие « Водоканал » , hereinafter “ the water supply company ” ) , in which he sought an order requiring them to lift the ban on the operation of the saw - mill and damages .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of the Republic of Adygeya ordered the water supply company not to prevent the applicant from carrying on his activity . The judgment was not appealed against and became final .
CARDINAL . NORP However , it was not enforced . Instead , the water supply company blocked the road leading to the saw - mill and switched off the electricity supply .
CARDINAL . The applicant was not issued with a warrant of execution until DATE pending a decision in another case in which a third party was trying to challenge his title to the saw - mill .
CARDINAL . On DATE the enforcement proceedings were set in motion .
CARDINAL . DATE the bailiff suspended the enforcement proceedings and applied for clarification of the judgment of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG held that the judgment of DATE had to be enforced exactly as it was worded .
CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiff brought the enforcement proceedings to an end . However , the access road remained blocked and the electricity supply was not restored .
CARDINAL . The applicant appealed against the decision to discontinue the enforcement proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG quashed that decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the above judgment on appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE the enforcement proceedings were resumed .
CARDINAL . On DATE the director of the water supply company issued access passes to the applicant and his nominees .

CARDINAL . On DATE free access to the saw - mill was restored , and the obstacles preventing the applicant from using it were removed . He was invited to collect the passes , but failed to do so . When the bailiffs went to the applicant 's home to serve him with papers concerning the enforcement , they were unable to find him , but were met instead by his father , who refused to look at the papers and explained that the applicant had moved to another city .
CARDINAL . On DATE the enforcement proceedings were discontinued . The applicant did not appeal against that decision .
